1) Create a new Plug-in with the PDE, when it shows a dialog to define 
the "Java Source Folder", instead of using the defaulr "src", clean the field, 
so that there's no special folder for the sources.

2) Click Next, create a Default Plugin Structure, Finish

3) You get an error, "Path must include project and resource name".

Why is it failing ???

You cannot NOT have a source folder. If your plug-in is Java plug-in, you must 
have at least one source folder where your data is. If your plug-in should not 
contain Java code, choose this option in the page.

We will keep this defect to track the problem that we allowed you to continue. 
We should not allow you to press 'Next' without specifying source folder name.

See Bug 37118 - you also allowed an empty src folder name when importing an 
external one. If src folder is "" it means the same dir as the plug-in dir, I 
see no reason why "" should not be allowed, actually. It simply means "don't 
use a subdir, but the root plugin dir". It all worked in Eclipse, until we got 
to the export as described in Bug 37118.

Fixed.
You will be able to specify an empty source/output folder names, self-host, 
and export without any problems.

Note that this setting is still discourage, because it will make exporting 
your plug-in a little trickier, as you would not be able to specify which 
folders in your project should end up in the JAR.  The entire content of the 
project will end up in the jar.  If that is what you want, then this is a non-
issue.
